com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc

Class SignActionHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.SignActionHeader

  • public class SignActionHeader
extends java.lang.Object
    Accesses all the information available on the first line of a TrainCarts sign. This class acts both as a read-only container, and as a TC sign identifier.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SignActionHeader()

        public boolean isValid()

        Returns:
        True if valid, False if not

      • isLegacyConverted

        @Deprecated
public boolean isLegacyConverted()
        Deprecated. 
        Gets whether the format of the sign had been converted from a legacy format. This function will eventually disappear, do not use it!
        Returns:
        is legacy converted

      • isInverted

        public boolean isInverted()
        Redstone powering states should be inverted for this sign
        Returns:
        power inverted property

      • isAlwaysOn

        public boolean isAlwaysOn()
        The sign is always active, ignoring Redstone changes
        Returns:
        power always on

      • isAlwaysOff

        public boolean isAlwaysOff()
        The sign is always inactive, ignoring Redstone changes
        Returns:
        power always off

      • onPowerRising

        public boolean onPowerRising()
        Sign should be triggered on the rising edge of Redstone changes
        Returns:
        power on rising edge (power -> on)

      • onPowerFalling

        public boolean onPowerFalling()
        Sign should be triggered on the falling edge of Redstone changes
        Returns:
        power on falling edge (power -> off)

      • hasDirections

        public boolean hasDirections()
        Gets whether the watched directions of this Sign are defined. If this returns True, user-specified watched directions are used. If this returns False, environment-specific watched directions are used.
        Returns:
        has directions

      • getFaces

        public org.bukkit.block.BlockFace[] getFaces(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace absoluteDirection)
        Transforms the directions specified on this sign into BlockFaces using a known absolute direction
        Parameters:
        absoluteDirection - to convert the directions with
        Returns:
        BlockFace watched faces

      • getRedstoneAction

        public SignActionType getRedstoneAction(boolean newPowerState)
        Returns a REDSTONE_ON or REDSTONE_OFF action type depending on the power state and the setting applied to this sign header. When the redstone change should not produce an event, NONE is returned.
        Parameters:
        newPowerState - to get the event for
        Returns:
        sign action type to send to the sign action handlers

      • isActionFiltered

        public boolean isActionFiltered(SignActionType type)
        Gets whether a particular sign action is allowed to be executed according to this header
        Parameters:
        type - to check
        Returns:
        True if execution should be cancelled, False if not and execution can continue

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts this header information into a valid TrainCarts first-line sign format
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • parseFromEvent

        public static SignActionHeader parseFromEvent(SignActionEvent event)
        Parses the first line of a sign to a SignActionHeader. Returned header will signal isValid() when a valid TrainCarts header could be detected.
        Parameters:
        event - the event
        Returns:
        SignActionHeader

      • parseFromEvent

        public static SignActionHeader parseFromEvent(org.bukkit.event.block.SignChangeEvent event)
        Parses the first line in a SignChangeEvent to a SignActionHeader. Returned header will signal isValid() when a valid TrainCarts header could be detected.
        Parameters:
        event - the event
        Returns:
        SignActionHeader

      • parseFromSign

        Returns:
